intro: Sonchus glabra, commonly known as common sowthistle, is a herbaceous annual plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its smooth, hairless leaves that are typically lobed or toothed, and its yellow composite flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant grows up to 30–60 cm tall and thrives in disturbed soils, often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. It is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its rapid growth and ability to spread through seeds.
